BlockDevice.description: BlockDevice is a subproperty of BlockDeviceMapping that describes an Amazon EBS volume.

properties.name: DeleteOnTermination
properties.description: Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

type.description: Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

properties.name: Encrypted
properties.description: Specifies whether the volume should be encrypted.

type.description: Specifies whether the volume should be encrypted.

properties.name: Iops
properties.description: The number of input/output (I/O) operations per second (IOPS) to provision for the volume.

type.description: The number of input/output (I/O) operations per second (IOPS) to provision for the volume.

properties.name: SnapshotId
properties.description: The snapshot ID of the volume to use.

type.description: The snapshot ID of the volume to use.

properties.name: Throughput
properties.description: The throughput (MiBps) to provision for a gp3 volume.

type.description: The throughput (MiBps) to provision for a gp3 volume.

properties.name: VolumeSize
properties.description: The volume size, in GiBs.

type.description: The volume size, in GiBs.

properties.name: VolumeType
properties.description: The volume type.

type.description: The volume type.

BlockDeviceMapping.description: BlockDeviceMapping is a property of AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration that describes a block device mapping for an Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: DeviceName
properties.description: The device name exposed to the EC2 instance (for example, /dev/sdh or xvdh).

type.description: The device name exposed to the EC2 instance (for example, /dev/sdh or xvdh).

properties.name: Ebs
properties.description: Parameters used to automatically set up EBS volumes when an instance is launched.

type.description: Parameters used to automatically set up EBS volumes when an instance is launched.

properties.name: NoDevice
properties.description: Setting this value to true suppresses the specified device included in the block device mapping of the AMI.

type.description: Setting this value to true suppresses the specified device included in the block device mapping of the AMI.

properties.name: VirtualName
properties.description: The name of the virtual device.

type.description: The name of the virtual device.

MetadataOptions.description: MetadataOptions is a property of AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration that describes metadata options for the instances.

properties.name: HttpEndpoint
properties.description: This parameter enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances.

type.description: This parameter enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances.

properties.name: HttpPutResponseHopLimit
properties.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests.

type.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests.

properties.name: HttpTokens
properties.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests.

type.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests.

resource.description: The AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration resource specifies the launch configuration that can be used by an Auto Scaling group to configure Amazon EC2 instances.

properties.name: AssociatePublicIpAddress
properties.description: For Auto Scaling groups that are running in a virtual private cloud (VPC), specifies whether to assign a public IP address to the group's instances.

type.description: For Auto Scaling groups that are running in a virtual private cloud (VPC), specifies whether to assign a public IP address to the group's instances.

properties.name: BlockDeviceMappings
properties.description: Specifies how block devices are exposed to the instance. You can specify virtual devices and EBS volumes.

type.description: Specifies how block devices are exposed to the instance. You can specify virtual devices and EBS volumes.

properties.name: ClassicLinkVPCId
properties.description: The ID of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC to link your EC2-Classic instances to.

type.description: The ID of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC to link your EC2-Classic instances to.

properties.name: ClassicLinkVPCSecurityGroups
properties.description: The IDs of one or more security groups for the VPC that you specified in the ClassicLinkVPCId property.

type.description: The IDs of one or more security groups for the VPC that you specified in the ClassicLinkVPCId property.

properties.name: EbsOptimized
properties.description: Specifies whether the launch configuration is optimized for EBS I/O (true) or not (false).

type.description: Specifies whether the launch configuration is optimized for EBS I/O (true) or not (false).

properties.name: IamInstanceProfile
properties.description: Provides the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance. The instance profile contains the IAM role.

type.description: Provides the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance. The instance profile contains the IAM role.

properties.name: ImageId
properties.description: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

type.description: Provides the unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that was assigned during registration.

properties.name: InstanceId
properties.description: The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance you want to use to create the launch configuration.

type.description: The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance you want to use to create the launch configuration.

properties.name: InstanceMonitoring
properties.description: Controls whether instances in this group are launched with detailed (true) or basic (false) monitoring.

type.description: Controls whether instances in this group are launched with detailed (true) or basic (false) monitoring.

properties.name: InstanceType
properties.description: Specifies the instance type of the EC2 instance.

type.description: Specifies the instance type of the EC2 instance.

properties.name: KernelId
properties.description: Provides the ID of the kernel associated with the EC2 AMI.

type.description: Provides the ID of the kernel associated with the EC2 AMI.

properties.name: KeyName
properties.description: Provides the name of the EC2 key pair.

type.description: Provides the name of the EC2 key pair.

properties.name: LaunchConfigurationName
properties.description: The name of the launch configuration. This name must be unique per Region per account.

type.description: The name of the launch configuration. This name must be unique per Region per account.

properties.name: MetadataOptions
properties.description: The metadata options for the instances.

type.description: The metadata options for the instances.

properties.name: PlacementTenancy
properties.description: The tenancy of the instance, either default or dedicated.

type.description: The tenancy of the instance, either default or dedicated.

properties.name: RamDiskId
properties.description: The ID of the RAM disk to select.

type.description: The ID of the RAM disk to select.

properties.name: SecurityGroups
properties.description: A list that contains the security groups to assign to the instances in the Auto Scaling group.

type.description: A list that contains the security groups to assign to the instances in the Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: SpotPrice
properties.description: The maximum hourly price you are willing to pay for any Spot Instances launched to fulfill the request.

type.description: The maximum hourly price you are willing to pay for any Spot Instances launched to fulfill the request.

properties.name: UserData
properties.description: The Base64-encoded user data to make available to the launched EC2 instances.

type.description: The Base64-encoded user data to make available to the launched EC2 instances.
